item.description:
Come stroll our pets down the quaint little village of Old Historic Deerfield. Main Street is 1 mile long and we can walk our dogs along the sidewalks up one side and back on the other to see the historic houses of the village. It is a nice, tree-lined street that is an easy walk. Dogs MUST be On Leash.
We should park at the end of Albany Street which is next to the Old Burying Grounds. After we come back, there is a path at the Burying Grounds in the woods that we can also check out with our dogs.
Directions from Springfield are to take exit 24 off Rt 91 and head north on routes 5&10. Continue on this road for about 5.4 miles. Look for the brown signs for Historic Deerfield on the left. Take a left onto Memorial St and take a right at the end, this is Old Main St.
Directions from Greenfield are to go south on Routes 5 &10, look on the right for brown signs for Historic Deerfield, take a right onto Memorial St, and go to the end. Take a right at the end, this is Old Main St.
Once on Old Main St, look for the Town Common on the left and take that left onto Albany Road. Go to the end and park.
We will meet there.
Here is the link to Historic Deerfield:
http://www.historic-deerfield.org/

National Dog Day is August 26, was started in 2004, and is a day to honor your dog and the love you have for your dog. Show your dog a little extra appreciation this day by joining me in walking my little girl I rescued from a shelter, Maggie. If you can't make it, that's OK, give your dog an extra big hug, donate to your local animal shelter, or some other way to make this a special day for the dogs.
It's All About The Dogs!

Here is the website:
http://www.nationaldogday.com/
Browse around that page and there are links on suggestions for how you can celebrate National Dog Day.

Facebook has a page for National Dog Day: http://www.facebook.com/NationalDogDay?ref=stream

group.name: Western Mass Dogs - Walks and more!

item.name: Celebrate National Dog Day, walk our dogs down Old Main St in Historic Deerfield
